page.title: 15RELIGION: ST. MARY'S CHURCH
page.content: The church dedicated to{St. Mary}lies on rising ground at the eastern edge of the town. A stream separates the town from the church. Parts of the {chancel }and{north transept}are the oldest being built around{1250.}The main part of the church was built in the{14th century}and the{tower}and {porch}were added in the{15th {century.}There are six bells in the tower and the oldest bells are 18th century. At this end of the church there is a plain round{font}which is very old. Next to the porch is a small tower with stone steps leading up to where the{Sunday School}meet. The chancel contains a big colourful window of Jesus at the last supper. Separating the chancel from the main church is a beautiful wooden screen which has carved figures and flowers.
